title: compileBooleanMatcher fails when prefix and suffix overlap
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behavior?**

Currently, the [compileBooleanMatcher](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/master/lib/util/compileBooleanMatcher.js#L23) function is being fooled when the common prefix and suffix of two expressions overlap. This, in turn, leads to incorrect code being generated by [JsonpChunkLoadingRuntimeModule](https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/af52c8f0457b1055098d6b7b545b257404d06c93/lib/web/JsonpChunkLoadingRuntimeModule.js#L144) which, in my case, tries to load a consumed module as if it had been bundled locally, thus making the web server return a `Not found` error and failing the page load.

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**

I cannot send a small test project to reproduce it because:

1. [My project](https://github.com/liferay/liferay-portal) setup is huge and I'm working in a current development locally.
2. I'm not quite sure how it could be reproduced in a small project because it depends on the dependency graph and federation config.

Anyway, I'm going to fix this in a following PR with a test, where it is easy to see why the production code was wrong and, looking at the test, what I was expecting to work correctly.

<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->
<!-- Please only add small code snippets directly into this issue -->
<!-- https://gist.github.com is a good place for longer code snippets -->
<!-- If your issue is caused by a plugin or loader, please create an issue on the loader/plugin repository instead -->

**What is the expected behavior?**

The expected behavior is that the computed regexp matches the setup correctly (see the unit test in the associated PR).

<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**
webpack version:  5.11.0
Node.js version: 12.16.3
Operating System: ArchLinux
Additional tools: yarn 1.22.4
